title: Update menu dataset and ensure search/price display stays consistent

requirements.summary: Replace menuCategories data so sections and items exactly match the latest pasted menu text (names, descriptions, and prices), with no extra categories/items.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/data/menuData.ts` contains a `menuCategories` dataset whose categories and items match the pasted menu text (sections, item names, descriptions in parentheses, and prices) with no extra categories/items not present in the pasted text.
Section/category names match the pasted headings exactly (including spelling/typos such as those in the pasted menu).
Items that have a parenthetical description in the pasted text are represented via `MenuItem.description` with the same wording (verbatim, aside from whitespace normalization).
Items that have no price in the pasted text are represented without `price` and without `priceLabel` (so the UI can fall back to a default display).

file_operations.description: Update the exported `menuCategories` dataset to exactly match the latest user-pasted menu text: add/remove/rename sections to match headings verbatim; add/remove/rename items; map parenthetical text to `description` (verbatim aside from whitespace normalization); ensure items with no price omit both `price` and `priceLabel`.

requirements.summary: Represent multi-price menu entries using priceLabel so displayed price text matches the pasted formatting exactly.
acceptanceCriteria: For any menu entry that has multiple prices separated by "/" in the pasted text, the corresponding `MenuItem` uses `priceLabel` (not `price`) and preserves the formatting shown in the pasted text (including spaces around "/" and any decimals if present).
Existing numeric single-price items continue to use `price` (number) and render with the current rupee formatting behavior.
The Menu page carousel and global search badges display `priceLabel` verbatim when present.

file_operations.description: For any items that have non-single numeric prices (e.g., values formatted like "410 / 430" or "40 / 45" in the pasted text), store the price string in `priceLabel` exactly as shown in the pasted text (including spaces and decimals) and do not set `price` for those items.

Confirm `formatMenuPrice(item)` continues to return `priceLabel` verbatim when present, and that items with only `price` still render with the existing rupee formatting; adjust only if needed to preserve exact pasted `priceLabel` formatting.

requirements.summary: Ensure /menu and global /search reflect the updated menu dataset and display correct category names and price badges (including priceLabel).
acceptanceCriteria: On `/menu`, searching by an updated item name returns that item in its category (case-insensitive matching).
On `/menu`, searching by an updated category/section name returns items from that category (case-insensitive matching).

On `/search`, searching for an updated item returns a result with `type: 'menu'`, the correct `category` (section name), and a `badge` that matches `formatMenuPrice(item)` (showing `priceLabel` verbatim when present).

file_operations.description: Keep the /menu filtering logic aligned with the updated `menuCategories` dataset and ensure matching remains case-insensitive; if necessary, normalize whitespace in the query and the compared fields so renamed/added items/categories from `menuData.ts` are consistently discoverable.

Ensure global search indexing uses the updated `menuCategories` data and returns `type: 'menu'` results with the correct `category` (section name) and `badge` from `formatMenuPrice(item)`; if necessary, enhance `normalizeText` to be consistent with /menu search (including whitespace normalization).
